page.title: 10Ecology NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The sixty acre reserve is owned by the Gwent Trust for Nature Conservation,and is situated South of the railway line between Whitewall and Blackwell reens.The reserve comprises of marshland and is the largest remnant of the Monmouthsire fen.The area contains a diverse flora,and provides a breeding place for marshland birds. In recent years since the trust,Many development projects have taken place.These include the enlargement of the pond;building of a hide;bridge building, and the laying of paths in an attempt to protect the breeding areas. As farmers drained their fields to improve agricultural land mu1ch of the marshland was destroyed.The reserve provides one area in the region where a marshland habitat is preserved.
